message.content: This question requires an understanding of the principles of color and reflection. When an item is blue, it means that it absorbs all colors in the visible spectrum except for blue, which is reflected back to our eyes. Therefore, a blue colored item will only reflect an exact matching color, which is blue. Option (A) is incorrect because a blue object does not reflect all colors in the spectrum. Option (B) is incorrect because a blue object does not reflect the color white. Option (C) is incorrect because a blue object reflects only one color, not a combination of colors.

This question requires knowledge about the physics of light and color. When an item appears blue, it means that it is reflecting or emitting blue light. Therefore, it will only reflect an exact matching blue color. Option (A) is incorrect because if the item reflected all colors in the spectrum, it would appear white. Option (B) is incorrect because white is a combination of all colors, not just one. Option (C) is incorrect because a combination of colors would create a different color, not just blue.

This question requires some basic knowledge about color and how objects interact with light. A blue-colored item will only reflect light that has a wavelength corresponding to the color blue. This means that it absorbs all other colors in the spectrum and only reflects or emits the blue color. Option (A) is incorrect because a blue-colored item does not reflect all colors in the spectrum. Option (B) is incorrect because white is not a color that a blue item reflects. Option (C) is incorrect because a blue item reflects or emits only the color blue, not a combination of colors.

Option (C) is incorrect because a blue colored item does not reflect a combination of colors, but instead only reflects the color blue. Option (D) is the correct answer because the reflection of the blue color is an exact matching color.
